lean.description: Achieving a 'Lean & Toned' physique will require a significant reduction in body fat percentage while maintaining muscle mass. This necessitates a disciplined approach to diet, including calorie tracking and macro management, combined with a consistent weightlifting and cardio routine.

athletic.description: An 'Athletic Build' focuses on improved fitness and a more defined physique without prioritizing extreme leanness. This involves a balanced diet, regular strength training, and incorporating activities like running, swimming, or sports to enhance overall athleticism.

muscle.description: Gaining a considerable amount of muscle mass and achieving a physique similar to the 'Muscle Gain' goal will require a dedicated bulking phase with a caloric surplus, followed by a cutting phase to reveal the muscle. This demands meticulous tracking of calories and macronutrients, intense weightlifting, and sufficient rest and recovery.

recommendation.reasoning: Starting with the 'Athletic Build' is the most sustainable approach. It provides a good balance between improving fitness, building some muscle, and reducing body fat. This path sets a solid foundation for potentially pursuing the 'Lean & Toned' or 'Muscle Gain' goals later on, as it establishes healthy habits and a consistent workout routine. It is more realistic and achievable in the short term.
